definitions.definition: A common substance, chemically consisting mainly of sodium chloride ( NaCl ), used extensively as a condiment and preservative .
( chemistry ) One of the compounds formed from the reaction of an acid with a base , where a positive ion replaces a hydrogen of the acid.
( uncommon , countable ) A salt marsh , a saline marsh at the shore of a sea.
( slang , countable ) A sailor ( also old salt ) .
( cryptography ) A sequence of random data added to plain text data (such as passwords or messages) prior to encryption or hashing , in order to make brute force decryption more difficult.
A person who seeks employment at a company in order to (once employed by it) help unionize it.
( obsolete , countable ) A dish for salt at table; a salt cellar .
( historical , in the plural ) Epsom salts or other salt used as a medicine .
( figurative , uncountable ) Skepticism and common sense .
examples: Any politician's statements must be taken with a grain of salt , but his need to be taken with a whole shaker of salt .

definitions.definition: ( Internet slang , uncountable ) Tears; indignation; outrage; arguing.
examples: There was so much salt in that thread about the poor casting decision.

definitions.definition: ( UK , historical , uncountable ) The money demanded by Eton schoolboys during the montem .

definitions.definition: A bounding ; a leaping ; a prance .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) A bounding ; a leaping ; a prance .
